discoveredAssets: localhost:5001 - Dalgona Challenges Flask web application (Python 2.7.18, Werkzeug 1.0.1) - Port 5001 - HIGH RISK
http://localhost:5001/ - Homepage endpoint showing Challenge 25 link - Status 200 - Missing security headers
http://localhost:5001/xss2 - XSS Challenge 2 endpoint - Status 500 (Internal Server Error) - Broken/buggy endpoint
http://localhost:5001/static/ - Static resources directory (CSS, images, assets) - Directory listing disabled

targets.objective: Test for XSS vulnerabilities (reflected, stored, DOM-based), missing security headers exploitation (clickjacking, MIME sniffing), and information disclosure through error messages
targets.rationale: Main application endpoint running on outdated Python 2.7.18 (EOL) and Werkzeug 1.0.1. No security headers present (X-Frame-Options, CSP, X-XSS-Protection, HSTS). Application is designed for XSS training, likely intentionally vulnerable.

targets.objective: Investigate the 500 Internal Server Error for potential information disclosure, error-based vulnerabilities, or application logic flaws. Test various parameters and HTTP methods to understand the error condition.
targets.rationale: Endpoint consistently returns 500 error regardless of parameters. This broken endpoint may reveal sensitive information through stack traces in debug mode, or indicate underlying vulnerabilities in error handling. Only accepts GET/HEAD/OPTIONS methods.

targets.objective: Test for directory traversal, file disclosure, and sensitive file exposure. Attempt to access files outside the static directory using path traversal techniques.
targets.rationale: Static file serving endpoint. Directory listing is disabled but individual files are accessible. Test for path traversal vulnerabilities and exposed sensitive files (.env, config files, source code).

targets.objective: Test for Flask-specific vulnerabilities including SSTI (Server-Side Template Injection), session management flaws, and Werkzeug debug console access. Probe for additional hidden endpoints through fuzzing.
targets.rationale: Flask application running on development server (Werkzeug). Development servers often have debug features enabled. Old versions (Werkzeug 1.0.1, Python 2.7.18) may have known CVEs.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Python 2.7.18 End-of-Life - Application runs on Python 2.7.18 which reached end-of-life in January 2020 and no longer receives security updates
[HIGH] Outdated Werkzeug Version - Werkzeug 1.0.1 is significantly outdated (current is 3.x). Known vulnerabilities may exist in this version
[HIGH] Missing Security Headers - No security headers present: X-Frame-Options, Content-Security-Policy, X-XSS-Protection, Strict-Transport-Security, X-Content-Type-Options, Referrer-Policy
[HIGH] Clickjacking Vulnerability - Missing X-Frame-Options header allows the application to be embedded in iframes, enabling clickjacking attacks
[MEDIUM] Broken Endpoint /xss2 - Endpoint returns 500 Internal Server Error, indicating application bug or misconfiguration
[MEDIUM] Development Server in Use - Werkzeug development server is not suitable for production and may expose debug features
[MEDIUM] Non-existent Endpoint Referenced - Homepage links to /xss25 which returns 404, indicating incomplete implementation
[LOW] HTTP Only (No HTTPS) - Application only accessible via HTTP on localhost, no SSL/TLS encryption
[LOW] Directory Listing Disabled - Static directory does not allow directory listing (security best practice implemented)
